newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Coffee seen building support for upmove.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Coffee seen building support for upmove.

text.p: SEPT Close * Support * Resist * RSI14 * MA10 * MA40
Coffee is likely to need to do more support-building ahead of any attack on strong resistance at $1,700, analysts said.
Traders called it to open $14 down on numbers, but were expecting to see it unchanged.
Coffee has been building support after its big fall from the highs seen at the end of May, Susan Rigg, analyst at Chart Analysis said.
New York coffee futures ended narrowly mixed in uneventful dealings on Friday.
"It was a very slow session," said one trader. "The market just seems to be in a holding pattern waiting to see what develops with the (Brazil) weather next week."

Tight supplies of high-quality arabica coffee and continued dry weather in Central America could propel coffee futures on New York's Coffee, Sugar and Cocoa Exchange (CSCE) well over the $2 per lb level, U.S. investment bank Merrill Lynch said, said in a report dated July 31.
No damaging cold is in sight for Brazil's coffee areas over the next five days, independent forecaster Weather Services Corporation said on Monday.
Growers in Brazil's Cooxupe cooperative in Guaxupe, Minas Gerais state, revised downwards their estimate for their 1997/98 coffee crop to 395,065 60-kg bags from a forecast of 433,586 bags in April.
This represented a 49.36 percent drop in relation with 1996/97, Cooxupe said in a statement. The cooperative polled 400 growers.
Colombia's National Coffee Growers' Federation increased the internal coffee price Friday 0.6 percent to 318,875 pesos per 125-kg load.
The previous price for a load set last week was 317,000 pesos.
Indian coffee exporters and traders said they were exploring possibilities of setting up a futures exchange in a bid to minimise risks in a volatile market.
"There's a need for trading in coffee futures in the new environment of liberalisation," said Arun Bidappa, chief executive of Karnataka Coffee Brokers' Pvt Ltd, a firm involved in coffee auctions.
